page.title: 02Skenfrith Church
page.content: St. Bridget's was built between 1228 and 1232 and is 750 years old. It was built of stone and during its history has been enlarged and renovated. The most beautiful item in the church is a 500 year old cape called a 'Cope'.It is wine coloured velvet and is decorated with silk patterned pictures and embroidery. The stone 'Morgan's Tomb' is carved with the likenesses of the mother, father, four brothers and four sisters who are buried there. Other ancient items include the 750 year old font, a stone altar and a box pew. There are the remains of a rood screen which would have been taken down during the reign of Edward VI. Two stoops are set into the walls near the altar and in the porch.
